TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed Array2DModule extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Basic operations on 2-dimensional arrays.
Docs.remarks: F# and CLI multi-dimensional arrays are typically zero-based. However, CLI multi-dimensional arrays used in conjunction with external libraries (e.g. libraries associated with Visual Basic) be non-zero based, using a potentially different base for each dimension. The operations in this module will accept such arrays, and the basing on an input array will be propagated to a matching output array on the Array2D.map and Array2D.mapi operations. Non-zero-based arrays can also be created using Array2D.zeroCreateBased, Array2D.createBased and Array2D.initBased.

Docs.param: The input array.
Docs.summary: Fetches the base-index for the first dimension of the array.
Docs.returns: The base-index of the first dimension of the array.

Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.Array2D.copy : 'T[,] -> 'T[,]

Docs.param: The input array.
Docs.summary: Builds a new array whose elements are the same as the input array.
Docs.returns: A copy of the input array.
Docs.remarks: For non-zero-based arrays the basing on an input array will be propagated to the output array.

MemberSignature.Usage: Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.Array2DModule.CopyTo source sourceIndex1 sourceIndex2 target targetIndex1 targetIndex2 length1 length2

Docs.param: The source array.
The first-dimension index to begin copying from in the source array.
The second-dimension index to begin copying from in the source array.
The target array.
The first-dimension index to begin copying into in the target array.
The second-dimension index to begin copying into in the target array.
The number of elements to copy across the first dimension of the arrays.
The number of elements to copy across the second dimension of the arrays.
Docs.summary: Reads a range of elements from the first array and write them into the second.
Docs.exception: Thrown when any of the indices are negative or if either of the counts are larger than the dimensions of the array allow.

The index along the second dimension.

Docs.exception: Thrown when the indices are negative or exceed the bounds of the array.

Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.Array2D.map : ('T -> 'Result) -> 'T[,] -> 'Result[,]

Docs.param: A function that is applied to transform each item of the input array.
The input array.
Docs.summary: Builds a new array whose elements are the results of applying the given function to each of the elements of the array.
Docs.returns: An array whose elements have been transformed by the given mapping.
Docs.remarks: For non-zero-based arrays the basing on an input array will be propagated to the output array.

Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.Array2D.mapi : (int -> int -> 'T -> 'Result) -> 'T[,] -> 'Result[,]

Docs.param: A function that is applied to transform each element of the array. The two integers provide the index of the element.
The input array.
Docs.summary: Builds a new array whose elements are the results of applying the given function to each of the elements of the array. The integer indices passed to the function indicates the element being transformed.
Docs.returns: An array whose elements have been transformed by the given mapping.
Docs.remarks: For non-zero-based arrays the basing on an input array will be propagated to the output array.

Docs.summary: Builds a new array whose elements are the same as the input array but where a non-zero-based input array generates a corresponding zero-based output array.

Docs.param: The input array.
The index along the first dimension.
The index along the second dimension.
The value to set in the array.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of an element in an array. You can also use the syntax array.[index1,index2] <- value.
Docs.exception: Thrown when the indices are negative or exceed the bounds of the array.
